title: Grammys 2017: Katy Perry Performs in Tom Ford and a Planned Parenthood Pin - Vogue
text: Katy Perry Gets Political With Her Grammys Onstage Look February 13, 2017 4:30 AM by Janelle Okwodu Photo: Getty Images “We gonna call this era Purposeful Pop,” Katy Perry announced to fans on Twitter days before the release of her latest single, “Chained to the Rhythm.” The singer has been evolving her pop princess image toward a more socially conscious space for the past year, and at the Grammy Awards tonight, she unveiled a new song, look, and attitude. Stepping onstage with Skip Marley, Perry wore a tailored white Tom Ford pantsuit with matching bustier and rounded sunglasses. Selecting a pair of sneakers from her namesake line, the singer kept things on brand, but her boldest style statement came in the form of a social justice statement. Wearing a Planned Parenthood pin on her lapel and a glittery armband with the word “persist” etched across it, Perry was unabashedly political throughout a performance that urged viewers to be just as outspoken. Perry’s willingness to literally wear her beliefs on her sleeve has become part of her persona, and her latest outfit incorporates the spirit of her many politically focused outfits. Unlike the time she wore a sparkle-covered version of the American flag, this latest number was a subtle tribute rather than a foray into kitsch. With her music and her presentation changing to reflect the woman she’s become, you can expect Perry’s next few looks to be equally exciting.
